content.description: Steep start up to a couple of big moves to reach the traverse. Traverse right on good holds but with really high feet. Clipping the anchor is a bit funky. Even though the anchor hangs down below the roof rope drag on this is pretty bad if you have someone following which is really the only way to clean it because of the traversing nature.
content.location: The furthest right of the center grouping of routes. Climbs up about 20 feet, then traverses right for about 20 feet.

content.description: Crux is where you find it. Stalactites to start, slopers up to an OK rest above the second bolt from where you can clip the 3rd bolt. Crimpy campus moves lead up to slopers and eventually jugs below the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts with fixed cable draws and a sport anchor.
content.location: The route with the fixed cable draws in the middle of the middle grouping of routes on the wall.

content.description: Starts on the rock mound left of Learning to Crawl. Grab a good incut flake to start which is a few feet to the right of an obvious stalactite, then move through a tough and reachy boulder problem to get through the bulge.
content.protection: Two bolts + rope directional bolt. No Anchors
content.location:
Two routes left of "No Recess". Recommended to stick clip #1, and the 2nd bolt of O.R.A.L (Route immediately left of "No Recess") as a belayer directional. 

  The end of the route is arbitrary. If you've clipped the 2nd bolt you've climbed the 13b, and adding the 5.7 climbing above the 2nd bolt will add absolutely nothing to the grade. It's possible to climb up and traverse over to the anchors of O.R.A.L. to clean but that can be a pain in the ass. The other option is to clip #2, climb as high as you feel like is necessary to claim a send, then downclimb, unclip #2, and lower off #1. If you were able to put #1 up with a stick clip you should be able to take it down with a stick clip too.

content.description: Short boulder problem near the first bolt on interesting rock quality that's quite sharp.   I had the impression of a chossy route before touching it, but in the end I didn't experience any holds breaking on me.

Climb learning to fly up to the massive jug, clip high left, then run it out all the way to the chains of Bolus. This is the same linkup as Hyper Salivation, but avoids the harder moves of that (better) linkup and instead mostly climbs on jugs.This is the route you do when you are trying to finish the wall and someone points out that you technically havent climbed everything on the wall until you do this linkup.
content.location: Links Learning to Fly and Bolus via a high traverse avoiding the crux sequences of Hyper Salivation.

content.description:
Scramble up the rock mound used to start Snaggletufaed but immediately move to the right utilizing holds hidden in the white limestone to gain the right leaning vaginal slot. Utilize this to pull up through the overhang to a good jug just under the mini-roof. Finish on jugs. 

  The name stands for "Over Rated Asshole League" and ORB stands for "Over Rated Bullshit".
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 anchor bolts and chains at the top.

content.description:
This route is pretty consistent from the time you leave the stalactite in the roof till you reach a jug by the last bolt.  

  Climb up on some scary tuffa features, some are cracked and hollow sounding. Make a big move to the lip and some bad holds. Work up onto the face with sharp holds and long moves. Take notice of the many rock scars and wonder if something is missing, based on the grade in the guide book (5.12c) it sure seems as if something is gone. Eventually gain a jug to the right of the last bolt. A few more moves on sharp holds takes one to the chain anchors. 

  Several of the bolts on this route are pretty badly rusted and water was dripping out of one of them, it did not really seem safe.
content.location: This route is the furthest left of the middle group, just left of Super Cruiser and Learning to Crawl which both have fixed draws. Climbs through stalactites at the left end of the low overhang to start.

content.description:
This route has some very cool features. 

  Start out by getting yourself over the initial roof with some difficulty. Then work up into the corner formed by the wall and the orange feature, gaining some cool tuffas. Make moves left to stand on the grey "nose" and climb up on pockets to a loose looking flake and the final clip, good holds reside up and left.
content.protection: 4 bolts and un-welded shuts for anchors. The hangers on the anchor should be replaced at a minimum as unwelded shuts really are not the safest option, the route would also benefit with in general moving the anchor down a little and quite a bit to the right as the rope runs over a lip and is pretty hard on it.
content.location: The route is the left most of the right group of routes it climbs up just to the left of a blocky orange section of rock that forms a series of dihedrals.

content.description:
Undercling up to a drilled 2 finger threader, then a broken looking undercling and edge. A couple more holds that seem as though they would be better leads up to a couple of honking jugs. A hard to find hold leads up to the horizontal below the final roof. Make moves up and right to an anchor. 

  This route is very steep, so steep you'd be better off cleaning it on TR.
content.location: 4th route from the right of the center grouping of routes. First route right of Bolus or 3rd route right of Super Cruiser (route with fixed cable draws).

content.description:
Step to the right off of the boulder onto the face, work up to a jug sidepull. Then some difficult moves off of sidepulls with limited feet leads to the flake. Jugs take you out the steepening wall to an anchor over the lip.  

  Easiest to clean by top roping.
content.location: Shimmy up the broken corner onto the ledge, the route climbs straight up from here but it is easier to step left onto the boulder and back right onto the wall.

content.description: Interesting moves on stalactites leads to a sloper and the second clip. A crimp and a mono leads to a jug. Some foot trickery makes the rest of the route more of a formality.
content.location: The route just right of Super Cruiser in the middle grouping of routes on the wall.

content.description: Start on stalactites up to some jugs. Traverse right on some slopers then up to some pockets, one of which is drilled (if you skip the drilled one, give yourself and extra letter grade) Above the pockets some very slick slopers await before good holds finally appear about 5 feet short of the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts with fixed quick draws and anchors.
content.location: The route with fixed draws to the left of Super Cruiser in the middle grouping of routes.

content.description: Climb Learning to Fly till you are in the middle of the crux but not through it, and make cruxy moves right passed a bolt to the start of the Bolus crux and follow this to the anchor. Clips the first 2 bolts of Learning to Fly then the bolt between Learning to Fly and Bolus and finally the 3rd and 4th bolts on Bolus. Very pumpy climbing, the hardest moves are linking the two routes plus you get the cruxes of both routes as well.
content.protection: 5 bolts, one fixed draw on Bolus and chain anchors with biners.
content.location: Starts up Learning to Fly and traverses to Bolus at the second bolt, finishes up Bolus.

content.description: The route climbs through a tall slot with a skinny downward-pointing tree growing from it. It climbs cool formations with fun footwork. Good project for low 5.10 climbers, or hit it on your way out for a decent well-bolted burn.

A route with a variety of holds and movement that is often overlooked in the Canyon. 

  Start traversing on tufa fins to the first underling and move upwards from here to the crux which is at the fourth bolt, involving a powerful move to a decent pocket.
content.protection: 5 bolts. Anchors are NOT shut, sport anchors so bring a biner or two.

content.description: Some long moves on good holds leads up to the second bolt with a fixed draw. Make a move up to a glued edge and a long move off of it to an edge up and left. A handful more difficult moves leads to a jug horizontal below the anchor. One more long move takes you to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts the second with a fixed draw and chain anchors with biners.
content.location: The second route right of Super Cruiser (the one with fixed cable draws).

climbs.name: Blood of the Dead (sangre de los muertos)

content.description:
If you are tall enough the crux is the pump. However if you are short there will be a few very difficult dynamic moves, one getting to the sharp flake by the second bolt and moving up off of it as well as the last move up to the horizontal below the roof and anchor. 

  This route has fin climbing but several of the holds are quite sharp.
content.protection: 3 bolts and Fixe sport clips on the anchors.
content.location: This route is the second route from the right end of the middle group of routes. It starts off of a big long boulder at an obvious big flake. There is a corner to climb to get up onto the ledge and boulder that the route starts from, then head right to the base of the route.

content.description:
Nice overhanging wall with stalactites down low in places. Mostly shaded most of the day, stays dry in a light rain except for the tops of the routes. Routes mostly from 5.11 to 5.13 with one 5.10. A handful of drilled pockets and some glue on a few routes. 

  In the left group of routes there are a couple of routes in a prominent white swath of rock then a grey bulge that is home to Bros Before Hoes 5.12+ after this there are a handfull of "unknown" routes that climb out or to the right of a big low roof. The route out the seam in the roof is undone while the routes to the right are about 5.13-. 

  The center group of routes:   1. No Reccess 5.12   2. Learning to Crawl 5.12c (fixed draws)   3. Super Cruiser 5.13b (fixed cable draws)   4. Learning to Fly 5.12b   4.5. Hyper Salvation 5.13b (link up of 4 and 5 @ the 2nd bolt)   5. Bolus 5.12d (fixed draw on 3rd bolt)   6. Love is a Fist 5.12c   7. Let them Eat Flake 5.12-   8. Blood of the Dead 5.11b   9. Telagraph Road 5.11 

  The right group of routes:   11. Mistaken Identity 5.11c   12. Pulmonary Choss 5.10   13. the guide book lists a 3rd line but I did not see it...OH I found it, climbs extreamly fractured rock just right of the previous route
